description: paper +â€Ž back, a shortening of the older term paper-backed book.

verbs.description: paperback (third-person singular simple present paperbacks, present participle paperbacking, simple past and past participle paperbacked)

entries.meaning: (transitive, publishing) To issue or publish (a book) in a paperback edition.
examples: Max was anticipating paperbacking The Bodley Head's books in house rather than licensing the paperback rights to a third party, like Penguin, which reduced his royalties and might eventually lose him authors to vertical publishers.
